reviews.text: We have stayed in the Talbot Hotel over the last few years and I have to say, every time we stay there we receive excellent service from all the staff- whether it be with the reservations, bar , leisure centre or restaurant staff. Rooms are beautiful, well equipped and cleaned to the highest standards. Food is excellent and they cater for all. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone considering staying there. We will definitely be paying a visit back again and again to this hotel. Wouldnt stay anywhere else in Wexford.
reviews.title: Had a fantastic weekend. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Excellent quality ,food, service and overall enjoyment.

reviews.text: This is a nice hotel in the public areas. Polite staff, excellent leisure facilities, good breakfast.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but take a tape measure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However.... take a tape measure and check the room dimensions. For a double room, 4* standard is 18 sq metres (excluding bathroom). If it is less than this ask for a bigger room. We had a twin room. The beds were squeezed in. One was hard up against the wall. The bathroom was small too.
reviews.title: A true gem by far one of my favourites

reviews.text: Stayed here for my wedding anniversary and brought the kids nothing was too much trouble, the receptionists were fantastic as were all the staff. The kids club was great as it freed up our evening from 6:30pm to 9:30pm and had the kids ready to sleep which was a godsend.We had an evening meal included in our package, i was expecting 'The same old' the usual you get with packages but the menu was well thought out with with good choices and the restrauant supervisor was very accomodating, very relaxed atmosphere the only problem was we could of spent the night there drinking wine, just sooooo relaxed and no screaming kids because the kids get feed at the kids club as well!!!! .The bar has a great menu also and they do a great value early bird up till 7 I THINK. And special thank you to Dick Walsh the General Manager you are great and again couldnt do enough its fantastic to see happy and helpfull staff in a hotel because it doesnt seem to be that common anymore, just a real breath of fresh air.Wexford is a fantastic town and the choice of restauants is amazing.I have already rebooked for October and cant wait, a big thank you to everyone in the talbot for making our stay so relaxed and memorable.
reviews.title: Brilliant staff & just a good hotel

reviews.text: I came here with my two teenage (14 & 16) lads, for a mid-week break & I have to say that it was a really good stay.
reviews.title: "Our second home"

reviews.text: Very impressed,especially with the staff.Full marks all around.
reviews.title: Agreat hotel

reviews.text: Excellent hotel, fab view, friendly & helpful staff, brill value for money, food was amazing, very relaxing atmosphere. Noisy toilets.
reviews.title: Excellent overall experience

reviews.text: Arrived late at the hotel and was asked for swipe of credit card for pre authorisation. I was then mistakenly charged double my rate and told I would have to wait until morning for refund. I then went to my room, which was supposedly booked for 2 adults and 2 children, only to find 1 double bed and a travel cot. I phoned down and was immediately moved to a more suitable room. The staff were quite helpful. The rooms are very shabby and could do with redecoration. The receptionist had refunded the overcharge in the morning however was not apologetic about the error. I would not stay there again.
reviews.title: Nice public areas, shame about the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: have ur breakfeast brought up to ur room on one morning as a treat for yourselves
reviews.title: as ever very good service and food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well located and generally is of the standard specified. However we felt that the staff were "going through the motions" especially the dining room staff. The manager at breakfast was quite enthusiastic but his staff were less so. The restaurant staff were less than buoyant also. There appeared to be an attitude of "it will do". The reception was good.
reviews.title: Good location for touring the south east. Hotel so so.
Back again for our 4th stay!
reviews.text: The talbot hotel is the best hotel we have stayed in Ireland, this is our 4th visit with our newborn son and this place just gets better each time. Mr Walsh and his team run a top class family friendly hotel where nothing is ever too much trouble.We stayed a week and had our son's christening here, the food was excellent and varied and we were given our own private function room which was beautifully decorated.A huge Thankyou Mr Walsh for making our stay so special and memorable, we will be back again very soon!

reviews.title: Very basic
reviews.text: The room was small, with a standard 140cm double bed, and had a uninspiring view of the kitchen's extractor cars. There appeared to be no heating source other than a wall-mounted air-conditioner/heating unit. This was too noisy to operate during the night and did not effectively heat the bathroom which remained decidedly chilly during our stay.

reviews.title: As a break in a Hotel should be
reviews.text: A quick dinner at the bar was OK, nothing special. Breakfast was lacklustre with tinned fruit and packed juices.

reviews.title: Relaxing break in Wexford
reviews.text: The reception staff were lovely but arriving back after midnight we were greeted by a gruff night manager and left to stand in the cold while he checked our names off a clipboard.

reviews.title: Lovely Stay in Wexford
reviews.text: We got a reasonable deal on the rate and really just needed a bed for the night, so the Talbot did the job. If you require more you might look elsewhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a short break in the Talbot Hotel and we found it has lost none of its special charm. We stayed there on a number of previous occasions and the outstanding memory we had was of the wonderful staff.That remains our opinion.We had a pleasant refurbished room with a sea view and,even though there was a lot of celebration going on outside as the Wexford camogie team had just won the All Ireland final , we were well cocooned from the noise because of the double glazing.
reviews.title: Wonderful Wexford staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good with plenty of choice including lovely fresh fish.Just ask for the fish of the day and it will take about 15 minutes as it is cooked to order.Lots of good rashers,sausages,mushrooms etc served piping hot and delicious brown bread baked on the premises,Also proper coffee!Michael who is the breakfast maitre d' is a real charmer!
reviews.title: 4 star hotel ?? ? ??

reviews.text: Dinner was excellent value at €25 for 4 course table d'hote with lots of choice.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and Great Value

reviews.text: The Ballast Bar may appeal to younger guests as the Oyster Restaurant was busy with many older guests when we were there.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: We didn't avail of the leisure centre so can't comment on that.
reviews.title: love the hotel but please do something about the tv in the rooms

reviews.text: We stayed here the night before a trip to france to get some rest before our ferry crossing. The rooms are average size and in my humble opinion could do with a revamp soon. We have an 8 month old child so after dinner we found ourselves back in the room at around 10pm. However we could here music from the bar beating up through the room. I went down to complain and was told that the hotel was very busy and no other rooms were available and that they would sort something out in the morning with the general manager in terms of compensation. I returned to my room and the music stopped at around 12.30 that night. Therefore if you are not going to be in your room before this time it's probably not an issue but if you have young kids and will be in the room you'll be very annoyed. The next morning on check out the general manager was at reception and when i explained my issue he asked me to give him a call the next time i stay in the hotel and he would upgrade us free. (Some compensation!!!!)His repsonse to me was more frustrating than the music coming through my room as i was not compensated but handed a carrot to try and intyse me back to even make more money from me. Other than this the restaurant is very good quality and reasonably priced and the hotel is within walking distance of the town.
reviews.title: Not a bad hotel but make sure your room is not above the bar

reviews.text: I arrived at 10:00 pm tired and needing food. Parking was very easy at convenient.
reviews.title: Good hotel with a nice buzz

reviews.text: Hotel receptionist was great, quick check in, and she advised they only had room service at 10pm (which is reasonable). She guided us to a local Chinese and offered to take bags to room! Excellent service! Lots of people eating in the hotel, and a good bar, it looked like lots of fun, and this was Monday night!
reviews.title: Love this hotel but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back at 11pm checked out the room - it was ok - Old fashioned square TV's, had to pay for WiFi, and the Duvet was 'worn' and could do with a replacement,
reviews.title: We loved it and would recommend to anyone

reviews.text: I was staying at front of hotel - rang down and asked where they switching off the front lights on the hotel so I could sleep -they happily agreed. Had to phone security in middle of the night, as a naked drunk man got lost and was outside my room. ( I saw the funny side the next day!! )
reviews.title: Simple clean no Frills hotel, great value for money & staff so helpful & friendly
Kip
reviews.text: I have nothing good to say about this hotel other than it is no better than last year and the year before food, room, comfort staff all terrible and does not deserve the stars it has...stay away ....I don't have even 200 characters to write....not worth the effort.................

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here overnight on a Sunday promotion with a sea view room, breakfast and dinner included just 89 euro for two. The hotel is in an excellent spot, just a few minutes walk from all the buzz of Wexford's main street. The view was excellent, the room was clean perhaps a little small but it had everything one would expect. The evening dinner was of a far higher quality than we expected for the price we paid, It would be extremely difficult to remember having tastier fresher cod than was served, it literally melted on the tongue it was so fresh, accompanied by a good choice of seasonal veg, we had asian spring roll starters, nicer than expected, and finished with a very nice tiramisu, the ambience was lovely and the staff excellent and attentive. Unfortunately we missed breakfast due to falling asleep so late as it was extremely difficult to sleep with the heat in the room (early May), we left the window open but had to listen to a lot of traffic and passerby noise and also the noise of residents arriving back to the hotel late at night as we were beside the lift. We would stay in the Talbot again but not in the seaview rooms on the 3rd floor in order to get some sleep. We would highly recommend a trip to Greenacres restaurant for lunch, the food and wine and service are excellent, you can also enjoy the fine art and sculptures in the gallery and take away fabulous treats, if you are a food and wine buff this is the place for you!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, Sunday Promotion excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for 5 days while attending the Pierce Turner Gathering event. It was our second time at the Talbot, and once again, our stay was extremely comfortable. Our spacious 4th floor room overlooked the Harbour; breakfast was included and was delicious and plentiful. The front desk service was friendly, and we appreciated the early check-in after our arrival on the midday train. We always enjoy the comfort of the large lounge for simply enjoying morning coffee with a newspaper. The bar, carvery lunch and a la carte menu are all excellent. The Talbot, which is within easy walking distance of the town centre, will continue to be our first choice in Wexford.
reviews.title: A real home away from home

reviews.text: Beautiful sea views but noisy due to railway directly in front of hotel. Food good. Pillows and duvet lumpy, rooms hot even though not hot outside, otherwise bedrooms well appointed and staff friendly and efficient
reviews.title: Nice hotel good facilities lovely views noisy due to railway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our first night here on arriving on the ferry from Fishguard. We were touring the area over 5 days and enjoyed our stay here. It has a good location and is right on the front. The food in the bar was exellent and good value for money. Professional and attentive staff and a bonus of entertainment as well. We based ourselves there on the day of our return ferry trip from Rosslare as some of our party were staying another night before sailing the following morning. As a large party we took up quite a few seats and also had our gear stacked up ready to leave. The staff were fine with this and didn't make us feel in the way at all. We hope to return in the future, thanks
reviews.title: A great place to stay in Wexford

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms clean breakfast and dinner excellent, service in restaurant was superb, girls on reception very helpful and courteous.Staff very efficient and helpful in the hotel. Music in the bar every night at the weekend, get in there before 9 if you want a seat.
reviews.title: best place to stay in Wexford

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just return from a break from the Talbot Hotel. We stay with yous on the 15th May on the triple break. It was good valu for the money. When we arrived at the hotel the woman on the reception desk was very friendly and check-in was very efficient. When we mentioned to the woman on the reception desk that my husband is a coeliac. The woman say there was no propably about this just mention it in the restaurant in the morning and in they evening when we are getting our dinner. When we went into the the bar to get something to eat the woman on the cashier desk was very friendly and very helpful. Our room was lovely , spacious and overlooking the sea. The breakfast was excellent and the staff were very friendly. When we mentioned to the staff that my husband is a coeliac. They went off and got him guten-free museli, gluten-free bread and gluten-free sausages. When we went into the restaurant for our evening meals again we mentioned to the staff that my husband was a coeliac. They catered for his gluten-free diet. The staff were again very friendly and very efficient in the restaurant. We would definity recommend this hotel to our families and friend. We really feel a value customer in the talbot hotel. We feel like home in the talbot hotel. We hope to visited this hotel next year.
reviews.title: Back again for our 3rd stay?"

reviews.text: I hired a function room for the Friday and Saturday and an overnight stay. When I booked I asked that I could have a room available for after my drive up from Kerry to get ready and was told there was no problem. We arrived spoke to reception who said there was no room available so we waited, then we asked again and was told not till after 2pm (I started at 2pm) I was very upset having spent out all the money on the facilities. The receptionist was trying her best but I asked to speak to a manager who some how managed to make the feel awful and the guilty party! We eventually got a room and I was able to get ready but by then I was so stressed out with the hotel and fed up that was it ! We cancelled our evening meal with them and went out and to be honest I dont think that I would return. This is a great hotel with great facilities but from a business side at weekends please dont bother and dont waste your money
reviews.title: Great for a weekend away... Not for Business !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped here for 3 nights on the triple treat deal, 129 euros per person which included breakfast and dinner - fantastic value. On arrival from the ferry at 7.30 a.m. on a Sunday morning (both being very tired and stressed out due to the bus strike!) the receptionist was very helpful and asked us to take a seat in the lobby and sorted out a room as quickly as possible so that we could get some sleep. We were even given complimentary coffee and toast which was very welcoming. The food here is delicious. Service in the restaurant was great on the first night, a little slower on the other two nights but the hotel was very busy and the staff remained pleasant at all times. We had a basic room at the back of the hotel which was very comfortable and very clean. The hotel is situated at the top of the main street and is ideal for visiting the local shops. We will definitely stay again when we next visit Wexford.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped here for a night while touring through Wexford and thought it was a great spot. Our room was huge and bright, up near the top floor in the modern glassed front part of the hotel, so the views out over the sea were stunning. Everything was very spacious and very comfortably furnished. The location is ideal, down on the waterfront but only a short walk to the nearby shops and restaurants. The pool facilities were very well maintained and the breakfast was superb, both because of the tasty food and also because of their friendly and efficient staff who kept everything moving along very smoothly. Excellent value and highly recommended.
reviews.title: Ticks All the Boxes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights great place ask for sea view,its location on the promenade is great also 3 mins.walk from main shopping street.Can't go wrong nice rooms,excellent bar and food.They seem to have entertainment most nights at about 21-30 hrs,we stayed on a wednesday and the gentleman singing was great!Super breakfast,full marks for hot plates for cooked food!Good hotel
reviews.title: nice one

reviews.text: Booked a family room,Got a room on the 1st floor. It was absolutely manky.Walls dirty, beds dirty looking-not even dressed properly, curtain rail crooked and carpet FILTHY.I was then offered a different room on the first floor.This was even worse.Eventually we got moved to the 5th floor which was lovely. Totally different decor and was very clean.Once we got moved our stay improved. Staff were lovely, food was devine, breakfast was fab and the loaction was spot on. First impressions were awful.The standard of the first floor was not up to scratch for a 4star hotel. There's nicer hostels out there. Even the corridor for the 1st floor hadnt seen a hoover in months. Clumps of dust everywhere. Its a shame really as the hotel has so much potential
reviews.title: lovely EVENTUALLY

reviews.text: Very good hotel - family room sizes quite good. Broadband very poor on the 4th floor and we could never connect from our hotel room. The hotel restaurant was very good and catered well for all the family.
reviews.title: Good trip

reviews.text: Our room at Talbot hotel was Ok. I missed the possibility to iron my dress,but otherwise the room was equipped as normal.But - if you sleep light it might be difficult to have a full night sleep.The Hotel is old,and sounds from People talking,walking and even coughing is easily heard.
reviews.title: Nice old hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is a huge building,nice old wooden carvings and decorations.There are several sitting areas,all Nice and well kept.
reviews.title: warm wellcome
